com.camerontec.catalys.server.schedule

Class ScheduledTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ExposableMBeanComponent
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.schedule.ScheduledTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IScheduledTask, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, Cloneable

    public class ScheduledTask
extends ExposableMBeanComponent
implements Cloneable, IScheduledTask
    Standard implementation of IScheduledTask.

    Can be exposed through JMX.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Object clone()
             throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Cloning keeps the existing schedule but creates a new task.

        Tasks need to be copied because each instance tends to have its own properties. For example the same type of task may be run at different times on different objects. Therefore the task will have multiple instances.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface IScheduledTask
        Overrides:
        clone in class ExposableMBeanComponent
        Returns:
        New scheduled task.
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException - Never.

        public void doTaskNow(boolean disableNextEvent)
        Execute the task.
        Parameters:
        disableNextEvent - whether the next event should be disabled

      • getDomainPrefix

        public String getDomainPrefix()
        Description copied from class: ExposableMBeanComponent
        This should identify the domain prefix for this instance.

        It can assume that all this instance's properties have been read.

        Default implementation returns null.

        Overrides:
        getDomainPrefix in class ExposableMBeanComponent
        Returns:
        This object's domain prefix. Can be null.

      • getMBean

        public Object getMBean()
        Description copied from class: ExposableMBeanComponent
        Return the managed bean that is actually registered with JMX. If the object in question is, itself, an MBean it will override this to simply return "this". Alternately, it could return an associated ModelMBean, for example.
        Specified by:
        getMBean in class ExposableMBeanComponent
        Returns:
        Managed Bean corresponding to this object.

      • getPropertiesString

        public String getPropertiesString()
        Description copied from class: ExposableMBeanComponent
        This should be a unique identifier of this instance within its domain in the standard JMX property/value format for object names. Namely: 
           property=value[,property=value]*

        It can assume that all this instance's properties have been read.

        Specified by:
        getPropertiesString in class ExposableMBeanComponent
        Returns:
        Property/Values string for this instance.

      • getNextEvents

        public List<TimeSpec> getNextEvents()
